data.title: GIS as a planning tool for the USF Co rural telecom and E-service project in Pakistan
data.meta_description: GIS as a planning tool for the USF Co rural telecom and E-service project in Pakistan
data.text:
The Strategic Plan of PIDS for the period 2016-2020 was made in the context of global and national agenda for addressing development challenges that Balochistan faces. With tremendous growth since 1999, PIDS and its Board have decided to pause and reflect on the future PIDS faces. As the organization moves into maturity, the operating environment it faces has also become more complex since its establishment. While reflecting on the achievement of the last 16 years, PIDS deemed it fit to have a 5-year Strategic Plan 2016-20 in order to have a more organized growth trajectory, optimal mobilisation of resources for greater societal impact on communities it serves across Balochistan.

India is a land of agriculture. It contains more rural of areas in which the development of technology has become mandatory for the country forwardness. Technology brings the people together and educate them without the actual education. The mobile technology has been playing vital role in daily lives of people. The programming level of IT field making the education, banking and connection between people. As per the latest news of many social activists IT influencing many parts of rural India. One of the great activists in the world Bill gates said “Mobile banking will revolutionise the rural areas to Urban by educating people with smartphone technology”. In India Aditya Birla group has launched its new advertise for its Idea cellular that is IIN which showing that learning is also possible in the rural areas via this tech. In rural areas the most Eye catching thing we can observe is “How the people hide their daily wages safely” lack of good habitats their money is vanishing through natural disasters or through lack of security. For these kind of people banking facility is required at most level. According to the survey, 80% of Indians in rural areas are unaware of banking. Introduction of mobile banking can make the people’s money safe. In rural India, most of the women are not Getting Education correctly. By Introducing this Smartphone Technology can lead all the women to get educated without any pressure of lack of security and harassment. Introduction of IT in Rural Areas Improves the Economy of The Country as well as it leads people to Agriculture their Minds with Scientific Methods and getting aware of Modern IT. The Currency and Stocks Can get to Indian Market Quite Efficiently. Introduction of IT in Rural India Can Also Reflects the Urban India. Furthermore the invitation of Foreign University and Research Labs to our Country is possible.
